page.title: 02Crop Farming:Great Bromley
page.content: This is the primary type of farming in this area.The average{farm size}is {200 hectares.}Most farmers are renting part of their land. The{main crops}grown are cereal crops,such as{barley & wheat,}root crops such as{potatoes & sugarbeet, {&beans.}The farmers rely on spraying crops with{artificial fungicides & {fertilizers}to improve & maintain their yields.In the past cattle were kept,but today only a few arable farmers keep{pigs or fatten turkeys. Horsedrawn ploughs have been replaced by{machinery,e.g. combine {harvesters.}Small fields have been amalgamated to make the machinery easier to use.{Farm buildings}are now made from{asbestos & steel.}These replaced brick & tile buildings which were expensive to build & difficult to maintain.
